repnme.cdata!:
Easing Armenia's transition to a
            market economy

abstracts.cdata!:
With independence in 1991, Armenia
            suffered a severe economic contraction. Between 1990 and
            1993, GDP dropped by more than 50 percent. This led to
            hyperinflation, a budget deficit that reached a high of 55
            percent, factory closures, little electricity supply, and
            large-scale emigration. About 80 percent of the population
            survived on humanitarian assistance and more than half the
            population lived below the poverty line.

docna.cdata!: Transicion de Armenia hacia una economia de mercado

display_title.display_title:
Easing Armenia's transition
            to a market economy : Transicion de Armenia hacia una
            economia de mercado

repnme.cdata!:
Armenia - Institution Building Loan and
            Structural Adjustment Technical Assistance Credit Projects

abstracts.cdata!:
Overall, the outcome of both the
            Institution Building Loan (IBL) and Structural Adjustment
            Technical Assistance Credit (SATAC) was satisfactory. The
            Government was committed to a detailed program of
            interventions, and accomplished most of the projects'
            objectives. The Bank responded with a relevant technical
            assistance to Armenia's needs and built management
            capacity, enabling key reforms, for the transition to a
            private sector based economy. The key lessons suggest that
            countries undergoing transition, require broad technical
            assistance, targeting prioritized areas of intervention,
            preferably, through various operations so as to attain
            sustainability. Technical assistance (TA) efficiency was
            achieved, namely due to the country's policy reform
            commitment, and the Government's selectivity and
            ownership of TA. Although the inclusion of a tight timetable
            carries the disadvantage of possible implementation delays,
            with the further need for project extensions, it may
            however, be helpful in providing the right focus for needed
            reforms, precisely upon economic adversity, when mostly
            needed. The flexibility on project components during
            implementation, maximized the loan effectiveness, and
            contributed to positive impacts under changing
            circumstances, such as the funds reallocation for the Public
            Sector Reform and commercial bank work-outs.

Armenia - Institution Building Loan and
            Structural Adjustment Technical Assistance Credit Projects

repnme.cdata!:
Armenia - Structural Adjustment Technical
            Assistance Credit Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The primary objective of the Structural
            Adjustment Technical Assistance Credit is to support the
            Government's reform program to stabilize the economy
            and create conditions for a resumption of growth and an
            improvement in living standards. This will be achieved
            through financing technical assistance necessary for the
            implementation of the Government's reform program. The
            project includes technical assistance in support of
            privatization and post-privatization, strengthening of the
            financial sector, civil service reform, and resource mobilization.
